string.name: exp1_content
string.value:
‚Ä¢ Morse code is based on "dots (¬∑) and dashes (-)"
‚Ä¢ Different combinations of dots and dashes represent letters, numbers, and symbols
‚Ä¢ This is the foundation of all Morse code and must be mastered

string.name: exp2_content
string.value:
‚Ä¢ SOS is an emergency distress signal that needs quick recognition
‚Ä¢ Compact transmission: The three characters (¬∑¬∑¬∑ --- ¬∑¬∑¬∑) are sent compactly without normal character spacing
‚Ä¢ Standard spacing rules: Normally, Morse code characters should have 3-unit spacing between them
‚Ä¢ SOS exception: But SOS, as an emergency signal, ignores this rule and sends compactly for faster recognition

string.name: exp3_content
string.value:
‚Ä¢ The 1:3:7 ratio is the core rule of Morse code
‚Ä¢ Dot = 1 unit, Dash = 3 units, Character spacing = 3 units, Word spacing = 7 units
‚Ä¢ This precise timing ensures accuracy and readability of information transmission

string.name: exp4_content
string.value:
‚Ä¢ Samuel Morse and Alfred Vail collaborated in the 1830-1840s
‚Ä¢ Initially used for telegraph systems, later evolved into international Morse code
‚Ä¢ Became the global standard for radio communication encoding

string.name: exp5_content
string.value:
‚Ä¢ Letters ‚Üí Numbers ‚Üí Symbols is the most scientific learning order
‚Ä¢ Master basic letters first, then learn numbers and symbols
‚Ä¢ Progressive learning to avoid information overload and improve efficiency

string.name: cexp1_content
string.value:
‚Ä¢ Chinese Morse code is a coding system specifically designed for Chinese characters
‚Ä¢ Uses combinations of dots (¬∑) and dashes (-) to represent Chinese characters
‚Ä¢ Combines traditional Morse code principles with Chinese language characteristics
‚Ä¢ Provides standardized encoding for Chinese communication

string.name: cexp2_content
string.value:
‚Ä¢ Chinese Morse code encoding is typically longer than English Morse code
‚Ä¢ This is because Chinese characters are numerous and require more dot-dash combinations
‚Ä¢ Each Chinese character has a unique Morse code representation
‚Ä¢ Increased encoding length ensures character uniqueness

string.name: cexp3_content
string.value:
‚Ä¢ 1920s: Initial establishment of Chinese Morse code standards
‚Ä¢ Developed to meet the needs of Chinese telegraph communication
‚Ä¢ International Telecommunication Union (ITU) participated in development
‚Ä¢ Modern standards formed through multiple optimizations

string.name: cexp4_content
string.value:
‚Ä¢ Military communication: Secret communication between troops
‚Ä¢ Aviation communication: Communication between pilots and ground control towers
‚Ä¢ Maritime communication: Communication between ships
‚Ä¢ Online chat is not a traditional application scenario

string.name: cexp5_content
string.value:
‚Ä¢ Starting with basic characters is most scientific
‚Ä¢ Basic characters are used frequently and easy to remember
‚Ä¢ Progressive learning to avoid information overload
‚Ä¢ Build learning confidence and improve efficiency

string.name: input_text_placeholder
string.value: Enter text here, e.g., Hello World

string.name: telegraph_code_description
string.value:
Chinese Telegraph Code (also known as "Chinese Telegraph Cipher") is a coding system designed for accurate and fast transmission and reception of Chinese characters during the telegraph transmission era.

‚Ä¢ Origin and Standardization
Originally developed by Sheng Xuanhuai in the late Qing Dynasty, it was later revised multiple times during the Republic of China and New China, forming a unified national standard. The common version is the "Standard Telegraph Code Book", which includes more than 7,000 commonly used Chinese characters.

‚Ä¢ Encoding Method
Each Chinese character corresponds to a four-digit numeric code, ranging from 0001 to 9999.
For example:
‚Ä¢ "‰∏≠" = 0029
‚Ä¢ "ÂõΩ" = 0049
‚Ä¢ "Áîµ" = 0168
‚Ä¢ "Á†Å" = 0203

‚Ä¢ Usage
In telegraph transmission, the sender only needs to send the corresponding four-digit number, and the receiver can look up the original Chinese character according to the code book. This ensures accurate transmission and facilitates cross-language communication (numbers are internationally universal).

This page can search by "Chinese character" or "telegraph code" for quick location.
